title: 107_hr3676
content: The Act titled "Medicare, Medicaid, and MCH Tobacco Use Cessation Promotion Act of 2001" amends the Social Security Act to include coverage for counseling for tobacco cessation under the Medicare program. This includes defining counseling for tobacco cessation as a covered service. The Act "Medicare, Medicaid, and MCH Tobacco Use Cessation Promotion Act of 2001" amends the Social Security Act to include coverage for counseling for tobacco cessation under Medicare. Counseling for tobacco cessation is defined as diagnostic, therapy, and counseling services for individuals using tobacco products, provided by a physician or other authorized healthcare professional. Payment and cost-sharing for these services are also addressed. The Act "Medicare, Medicaid, and MCH Tobacco Use Cessation Promotion Act of 2001" includes coverage for counseling for tobacco cessation under Medicare. Payment and cost-sharing for these services are addressed, with 100 percent payment for counseling services and the elimination of coinsurance and deductible for tobacco cessation counseling. The Act "Medicare, Medicaid, and MCH Tobacco Use Cessation Promotion Act of 2001" provides coverage for counseling for tobacco cessation under Medicare. Payment and cost-sharing for these services are addressed, with 100 percent payment for counseling services and the elimination of coinsurance and deductible for tobacco cessation counseling. Amendments made by this section apply to services furnished on or after January 1 of the first calendar year that begins at least 6 months after the date of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. Coverage of counseling for cessation of tobacco use under the Medicaid program. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Social Security Act regarding Medicaid coverage for tobacco use cessation medications and counseling for pregnant women. It includes removing exceptions for certain medications, requiring coverage of counseling for pregnant women, and removing cost-sharing for counseling services. Amendments to the Social Security Act require Medicaid coverage for tobacco cessation counseling for pregnant women. Effective January 1 of the first calendar year after 6 months from enactment, services must include counseling for cessation of tobacco use. Amendments to the Social Security Act now include tobacco cessation counseling and medications as part of quality maternal and child health services. This amendment will take effect upon the enactment of the Act.
